question_stem: A rectangular garden is to be created with a length, \(l\) metres, that is 15 metres longer than its width, \(w\) metres. The area of the garden must be greater than 700m\(^2\).

parts.solution_text: Let the width of the garden be \(w\) metres. The length is 15 metres longer than the width, so the length is \(w + 15\) metres.  The area of the rectangular garden is given by length multiplied by width.  We are told that the area must be greater than 700m\(^2\). Therefore, \(w(w + 15) > 700\).
